main.name: Kenny Reiners
main.description: I have a passion for cybersecurity and blockchain, and I plan on creating many React and Solidity based decentralized applications in the future, which you can find below!
main.bio: I've been in the cybersecurity realm for over 7 years now, and I'm working towards becoming a fully fledged blockchain engineer and smart contract developer.  I have a huge passion for blockchain technologies, specifically Ethereum, Chainlink, and smart contract development.  I have a great foundation in cybersecurity, but I've been transitioning to become a software engineer and decentralized application developer since the beginning of 2020.  I grew up in Minnesota, and love the outdoors. I currently live in Maryland with my wife Christine, and daughter Gwyneth.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to contact me at any time!

resume.skillmessage: My core cyber skillsets include threat hunting and incident response, network engineering, and data analytics. But see below for my software engineering skillsets!

education.description: The Cybersecurity Technology masters program provided me an extensive amount of knowledge with a focus on CISSP fundamentals.
Although this degree isn't very useful to me at a professional level, I'm a huge biohacker nerd, and love all things health and fitness.

work.company: Integrity Consulting and Engineering Security Solutions
work.title: Software Engineer / Database Administrator
work.description: I'm currently a software engineer and Oracle database administrator at a Navy Intelligence center in Maryland.  I love it so far!

work.title: Solutions Architect
work.description: I worked at a small cybersecurity company in Maryland called Blackwood for just under a year.  In this role I was one of the technical engineers that worked with the sales team to help provide architectural solutions, customer support, and technical demonstrations for enterprise grade cybersecurity tools.  I primarily worked with Splunk, but I also worked with Palo Alto Firewalls, Gigamon, and several other tools to a lesser extent.

work.title: Cryptologist Technician - Networks
work.description: I spent six years in active duty Navy as a Cryptologist Technician - Networks at Fort Meade, Maryland.  My first tour primarily consisted of network exploitation and SIGINT analysis of a foreign adversary.  I was a systems engineer for my second tour where I leveraged a mobile incident response and threat hunting toolkit for carrying out investigations into malicious attacks carried out by advanced persistent threats.
